SiteNameAddress: Railway Station Interchange, Station Road, Corby, NN17 1NA
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
PlanningHistory: Site was previously subject to a Starter Homes bid to the HCA.
Notes:
Site previously assessed through SHLAA as site 2030.

The site has been subject to a bid to the HCA for Starter Homes funding and it was assumed that 40 dwellings could be delivered on the site. However, as part of an urban design review, consideration was also made of a mix of uses being deployed on site which reduces the developable area for housing (assuming 50dph) an alternative yield of 29 dwellings has been assumed.

SiteNameAddress: Parkland Gateway, George Street, Corby, NN17 1QG

Notes:
Site previously assessed through SHLAA as site 2037.

The site was previously been subject to a bid to the HCA for Starter Homes funding and it was assumed that 40 dwellings could be delivered on the site. However, as part of an urban design review, consideration was also made of higher densities (flats) being deployed on site and assuming 100dph an alternative yield of 63 dwellings has been assumed.

SiteNameAddress: Scott Road Garages, Scott Road, Kettering, NN16 9JY
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
PlanningHistory: At Planning Policy Committee on 05.09.17 it was agreed to designate this site as a draft housing allocation in the draft Part 2 Local plan for consultation with a potential yield of 25 dwellings. Potential housing allocation in Kettering Borough Council's Part 2 Local Plan.
Notes:
Previously assessed through SHLAA as site 705.

Council owned site. Preference would be for affordable housing on site.

Different dwelling capaciites have been calculated for the site dependent on potential densities to be applied (taking account of the surrounding area). These entail either 17 houses at 50dph or 12 houses at 35 dph and these values take account (exclude) an area of the site under which a sewer easement runs.. A sewer easement crosses the site.

SiteNameAddress: Desborough Leisure Centre, Off Broadlands, Desborough, NN14 2YH
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
PlanningHistory:
Former Leisure Centre has been demolished. Site has been subject to an application for 304 dwellings (KET/2016/0044) albeit this was refused on 26/05/2016. An appeal has been lodged to this decision and is currently in progress (APP/L2820/W/16/3162430).

Details are available here: http://www.kettering.gov.uk/planningApplication?thisWeek=0&appNumber=KET%2F2016%2F0044&submit=Go
Notes:
For BFR assessment purposes it is assumed that development will only happen on the PDL element of site (and not the larger, wider site which includes extensive tracts of Greenfield). To derive these estimates it has been calculated that only 30% of the wider site is PDL so 70% of the overall site has been discounted for development, hence the minimum figure propsed of 46 net dwellings used.. Previously assessed through SHLAA as site 1165.

http://www.nnjpu.org.uk/publications/docdetail.asp?docid=1323
